page.title: 02TRANSPORT
page.content: Six very important roads cut through our area:the A34,A43,A423,A40,and Sunderland Avenue.Four of these roads are trunk-roads.Together with motorways, trunk-roads are the major roads in the country. In order to build the roads the existing farmland was bought by the council.Where the roads cut through large fields, bridges were built to enable animals and machinery to be moved.The trunk-roads carry a very heavy volume of traffic as does the Peartree Roundabout where the A34 and the A43 meet. It is the busiest roundabout in England!
